section.name: Long-term trend
section.topText: This section is based on fitting a straight line (or curve) to the data in a time series plot. Methods for fitting lines to data are described in much more detail in a section about Least Squares in the NCEA unit S3.5 Bivariate Data, so we recommend that you read that section while studying the first page below.
section.page: Many time series steadily increase or decrease over time and a linear model may describe the trend. This kind of model can be fitted by least squares.
If the trend is nonlinear, a quadratic model might describe the trend better and can also be fitted by least squares.
Linear and quadratic models can be used to forecast future values.
